entry.title: Personalized Photo Albums
entry.content:
Personalized Photo Albums

Customer

Printing company offering its services for universities, colleges and schools in the United States of America. It is offering creation of personalized collegiate books, calendars, postcards, business and greeting cards.

Objective and solution

The aim of the project was to create top quality, personalized and digitally-printed memorabilia targeted to college students, sports fans, and university alumni, that meant following tasks:

  • Enable educational institutions to create custom products by customization of the backgrounds, logos, images, icons and photos
  • Products should be digitally printed on-demand, thereby allowing for complete customization options
  • Integrate with number of online printing services allowing users to choose printing provider

Project highlights

  • Rich user experience was achieved by investments in the latest technologies and most advanced production equipment
  • With browser-based software, there is nothing to download and install
  • Integration with social networks allowed easy sharing of photo albums between end customers
  • Customers have complete control over product creation and personalization

entry.title: Marketing Materials Management
entry.content:
Marketing Materials Management

Customer

A global financial services company which provides investment banking, asset management and wealth management services for private, corporate and institutional clients worldwide, as well as retail clients.

It is one of the largest banks in the world. It is considered the world's second largest manager of private wealth assets, a leading provider of retail banking and commercial banking services.

Objective and solution

Customer wanted to replace a number of existing business processes related to the bank marketing materials.
The team was assigned to create the web based portal that will act as a central point for:

  • Marketing materials management and exchange
  • Cart and order management
  • Assets storage
  • User management
  • Personalized email subscriptions

Solution:

  • Orders processing and shopping cart based on Pageflex Storefront
  • Created Pageflex extension that mirrors and extends functionality of Campaign Manager
  • Created number of custom pages integrated into Pageflex to administer and control new extension

Project highlights

  • Fully automated PDF generation workflow which now is used throughout all the bank departments in more than 50 countries around the world
  • Created customizable order processing workflow

entry.title: Marketing Management Platform
entry.content:
Marketing Management Platform

Customer

A leading provider of Distributed Marketing Management Platforms (DMMP). By integrating best-in-class marketing and technology provides clients with a faster, more effective way to grow and manage their marketing initiatives through use of proprietary platform.

Objective and solution

The project was to create content management for Customer retail agents. System should collect financial information and allow to place orders of customized documents.

Major tasks:

  • Integrate ASP.NET based web application with Pageflex Server and Pageflex Storefront
  • Create business rule management system that will process financial information
  • Build complex products with use of document actions and custom steps
  • Provide automation of order placement using Storefront API
  • Develop a bunch of PageFlex extensions
  • Modify default Storefront web pages

Solution:

  • Created highly-customizable Form-Filling forms utilizing jQuery and jSINI
  • To make process more streamlined created plugins for Pageflex Studio
  • Integrated membership and setup synchronization with external systems
  • Provided Single Sign On subsystem

Project highlights

  • Solution significantly decreased time needed to prepare and complete single order
  • Created flexible data import subsystem for importing large bulks of data (hundreds of MBytes)
  • With system roll-out all the redundancy in Customer workflows was eliminated
